security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown content and JSON metadata. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own files. All 35 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the scanner misinterpreting documentation formatting as security threats. The backticks in markdown tables, file paths in documentation, and SHA256 content hash were incorrectly flagged. This skill provides architectural guidance only.

content.user_title: Explore codebase architecture and data flows
content.value_statement: This skill helps developers understand complex codebase structures by providing clear documentation on architecture, data flows, and system relationships. It guides exploration of database schemas, service layers, and API routes for faster onboarding and development.
actual_capabilities: Explore database schema and table relationships
Map data flows from components through API routes to database
Identify service layer patterns and business logic locations
Find API routes and their purposes
Locate type definitions organized by domain
limitations: Cannot access files outside of providing documentation references
Limited to providing guidance rather than performing actions
Cannot execute database queries or interact with services

use_cases.title: Onboard to codebase
use_cases.description: New team members quickly understand project structure, key files, and architectural patterns.

use_cases.title: Find implementation location
use_cases.description: Locate the right service, API route, or component for new feature development.

use_cases.title: Understand data relationships
use_cases.description: Map database tables, relationships, and data flow patterns across the system.

prompt_templates.title: Find file location
prompt_templates.prompt: Where is the consent service located and how does it connect to the distribution service?

prompt_templates.title: Map data flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Trace the data flow for a story from user action through to database storage.

prompt_templates.title: Database relationships
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the relationship between projects, stories, and transcripts tables.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-tenant patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: How does the multi-tenant isolation work in the API routes and service layer?

output_examples.input: Where is the user profile type defined and what tables does it connect to?
output: User profile types are defined in: src/types/database/user-profile.ts
The profile.tenant_id field connects to the multi-tenant isolation system

output_examples.input: How does Supabase client access work in this codebase?
output: Three client types exist for different contexts
Browser client: src/lib/supabase/client.ts for React components
Server SSR client: src/lib/supabase/client-ssr.ts for API routes
Service Role client: src/lib/supabase/service-role-client.ts for admin operations (bypasses RLS)
RLS is enforced on all client queries except Service Role

best_practices: Use this skill when starting work on a new feature to understand existing patterns
Combine with direct file reads to get complete understanding of code sections
Reference the quick reference tables for fast navigation to common locations
anti_patterns: Asking for code modifications - this skill provides documentation only
Expecting direct database access or query execution
Requesting real-time system monitoring or metrics

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is optimized for Claude Code CLI usage.

faq.question: What file types can this skill help me explore?
faq.answer: It covers TypeScript files including components, API routes, services, and database types.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. This is a documentation-only skill for exploration. It provides guidance but cannot write code.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads and provides information. It does not access external networks or modify files.

faq.question: How does this skill find information?
faq.answer: It provides pre-documented architectural guidance based on the Empathy Ledger documentation.

faq.question: How is this different from a general code search?
faq.answer: This skill provides context-aware architectural understanding rather than simple text matching.
